programme.title: Strike

Robin receives key information from a salesgirl at the boutique Lula visited, Strike asks Bristow about Lula's attempts to trace her biological roots and the impact on her adoptive family, while John points out that he, Tony and Yvette all have an alibi. However, Strike manages to unravel Tony's alibi as the truth about Lula's death is finally revealed. Tom Burke and Holliday Grainger star

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Oscar's second wife Maya arrives in London. As the family attempts to heal past divisions and celebrate the future, Hannah and Nathan fight to save their marriage. Elsewhere, Goldie finally has her day in court, only to discover a secret that changes everything. As Ruth fights to save all that she has worked for, help comes from an unusual source - but at a price. And Hannah, after receiving heartbreaking news about Christie, finally confronts the past. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: The moderator-elect of the Church of Scotland and a female companion are found naked in a car with their throats cut, but the church closes ranks as Rebus investigates the background to the case, uncovering long-buried rivalries, lies and grudges within the institution. Meanwhile, a retired police colleague in the early stages of dementia claims he is being poisoned by staff at his nursing home. Drama, starring Ken Stott, with Lorcan Cranitch, Andrew Neil and John Stahl

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Simon is ready to take on legal duties again, but his old ways see him involved with the wife of the local cricket captain. Olivia Godfrey, the owner of a sex shop, hires Peter to resolve a problem with the sponsorship deal she has with a sports club. Meanwhile, Henny Leach, a self-professed eco-warrior, proves to be a bit of a handful for Lyle and not as innocent as she makes out. Drama, starring Stephen Fry, with guest stars Miriam Margolyes and John Thomson

programme.title: Small Island

Adaptation of Andrea Levy's novel, starring Naomie Harris, Ruth Wilson, David Oyelowo, Ashley Walters and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.desc: Keanu seeks legal advice over access to Peggy and tries to get an order in place to stop Lisa taking her out the country, meanwhile Lisa tries to get what she needs to make a flight to Portugal. Stacey tells Martin the truth about her cam work

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, brother Josh and father Big Mark's road trip comes to an end in Cornwall, where they swim with horses in the shadow of St Michael's Mount. On a visit to a farmer's market, Josh and Mark take a bite of the world's hottest chilli pepper before heading to Hayle beach to try kitesurfing. Their training involves Mark Sr being repeatedly dunked in the sea - much to the amusement of his sons. The final accommodation is a villa on a private island accessible only by its own private suspension bridge. The trio then visit the Eden Project and take in the spectacular views from an enormous swing

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Young couple Emily and Maurice's narrow new-build garden in Bristol leaves a lot to be desired. They dream of an elegant Mediterranean-inspired space to rekindle happy holiday memories. Working within a £2,500 budget Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull create a stylish, contemporary spot that brings sunshine vibes to the pair's lives

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gravity (2013)
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News Special
programme.desc: Coverage of the Uxbridge and South Ruislip, Selby and Ainsty and Somerton and Frome by-election results

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles recounts the story of an injured lone walker, lost for two nights during a storm on the Isle of Skye. Plus, how a young woman suffered a terrifying encounter with a pink river dolphin while in travelling in Bolivia

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle find out what happens when a silverback gorilla has his authority threatened and meet a new pancake tortoise. Jean Johansson falls for a fennec fox who's looking for a partner

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Terraces in Summerstown in south-west London and Darlington, Co Durham, are bought at auction by investors, as is a semi-detached house in Crewe, Cheshire. As Martin Roberts reveals, two of the properties are given wonderful makeovers, while the third is flipped for a profit without any work being done

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Kingston Antiques Centre, south-west London, with the red and blue teams guided by experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester. Away from the contest, Natasha meets a local artist and learns about a photographic technique that is over 150 years old, before trying her hand at it herself

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by his uncle Matheson Green and nephew Daymon Britton, heading to Rothbury in Northumberland to sample a guided bird-watching walk before setting up camp on a farm that rents out converted horseboxes.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple hoping to relocate to rural Somerset on a budget of £700,000, looking for a home with enough land for animals and a glamping site. Away from the hunt, Alistair gets stuck in with some Cheddar making in the county where it originated

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Kettering to design a garden for Bridget that stirs childhood memories of her home in Ireland and remind her of holidays taken there

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Natasha Raskin Sharp head south to Hertfordshire in the super glam 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles takes part in a whirlwind shopping dash and also finds time to travel to Waddesdon in Buckinghamshire and the home of Baron Ferdinand De Rothschild. Natasha spends over £300, including a Victorian ink and wash painting of a grumpy girl and a stunning 19th-century Italian bronze vase

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The endeavours of golden retriever koda, an assistance dog to Mei, who having spent much of her teen years in care suffers from anxiety issues and an eating disorder. Before Koda arrived, 20-year-old Mei was too scared to leave her home, but now they are venturing out together. Koda is prone to falling asleep on the job and has a lot to learn, so Mei has signed them up for further training to help build the confidence she needs to head from Norfolk to London to participate in a function alongside Children's Commissioner for England, Rachel de Souza

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: It is Lucy's birthday and to celebrate Geoffrey and Wendy take her Lee, Toby and Anna for a trip on a vintage steam train. However, Lee's decision to play Poirot when a stranger turns up unannounced in their carriage risks Lucy's special day being ruined. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie takes on a more positive attitude, but then, one by one, things start to fall apart. Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family forced to move to Australia to become their Queen. Catherine Tate stars, with Rodger Corser

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
programme.desc: Peter Parker balances life as an ordinary high school student with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, while waiting in vain to join his mentor Iron Man on a world-saving mission. Determined to prove he is ready for bigger challenges, he investigates a spree of crimes committed with advanced weapons - leading him into a battle with a ruthless winged enemy on the hunt for priceless technology. Superhero adventure, starring Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Vietnam (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the opening match in Group E, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. The Americans have won the last two stagings of the tournament and it would be a major upset should they fail to defeat the tournament debutantes

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Patrick Williams and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed plus special guests Hilary and Michael Whitehall. Helen McGinn picks the wine to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: This time, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite recipes for low cost baking, using ingredients that do not break the bank or compromise on flavour. Dishes include fluffy onion pretzels, a potato rosti quiche, rhubarb and custard kisses, and her signature rich and indulgent chocolate fondant

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Revisiting a semi-detached property in the West Midlands. Plus, Tommy Walsh meets a first-time developer in Sittingbourne, Kent, and Martel Maxwell views a property in Tyne & Wear

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Phillip Serrell are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. Charlie Ross presents

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: St Helens v Leigh Leopards (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which takes place at Halliwell Jones Stadium in Warrington. Saints defeated Hull FC 32-18 away from home in their quarter-final match, while Leigh progressed to this stage of the competition following a 34-14 victory at York City Knights

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items. First to arrive is Princess from Surrey, with an unusual item - a set of wooden, carved apples, which are cut into different numbers of sections and were used to help children learn about fractions. Next, part-time entertainer Chris brings in a bed of nails, before 18-year-old Jude presents the dealers with a beautifully preserved, original account of a First World War Zeppelin raid on Southend

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull transform Lauren and Jonathan's Birmingham plot into a magical haven, taking their lead from a famous children's book that means a lot to the couple

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a father and daughter from from Bradford, two friends from Surrey, and a married couple from Swansea

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan asks general knowledge questions against the clock as contestants try to win money for their chosen charity and avoid being voted off the team. This episode features are Martin Roberts, Tanni Grey-Thompson, Melvin Odoom, Anneka Rice, John Bercow, Kelle Bryan, Richard Blackwood and Suzi Ruffell

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present the star-studded general knowledge quiz. Matt Richardson, Adam Rowe, Rav Wilding, Wayne Perrey, Sarah Cawood, Matthew Wright, Maisie Adam and Emily Lloyd-Saini try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna struggles through a relentless run of back-to-back shifts at the ED dealing with challenging cases - but exhaustion starts to take its toll, ending in disaster. Iain offers to help Faith with her recovery, but his proposed solution only drives her away. Sah confesses to Teddy, and Jan regrets her recent actions when she realises the damage it has caused to her relationship with Ffion

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Bosco is reunited with an old friend from prison, but the pressure of touring takes a toll on his mental health. His downward spiral culminates in a disastrous gig when he goes on stage drunk and initiates a serious confrontation with Bulla. The incident is too much for Honey, who starts making alternative plans. Meanwhile, Vita makes a decision she may later come to regret, and discovers a surprising side to her mother when Beres shows her a video of young Aria

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians (2018)
programme.desc: When New York University professor Rachel Chu heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, Nick Young, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family. The problem is they aren't so approving of her, so she attempts to win them over. Blockbusting comedy based on Kevin Kwan's novel, starring Constance Wu, Henry Golding, Gemma Chan and Michelle Yeoh

programme.title: The Bling Ring (2013)
programme.desc: Five teenagers united by an obsession with celebrity steal from the houses of the rich and famous stars they idolise, using the internet to follow their targets' movements. When the police finally catch up with them, the arrest brings a taste of the fame they have craved. Fact-based drama, starring Emma Watson and Israel Broussard

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive visits his favourite tourist spot of the Amalfi Coast, going inland to a mozzarella factory, before hopping across to the island of Capri, where he makes his wife a pair of the local sandals made famous by Jackie Kennedy. He also spends the evening singing folk songs at a nightclub favoured by celebrities including Beyonce and Jay-Z

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradford's Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of the Montgomery bus boycott, The Crown, the history of anaesthesia, and Stormzy, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Mike Carr, Samira Effa and Tom Anglesea compete in the heats for the North East region, each preparing starters and fish courses. Tom reveals some personal connections to this year's music brief, beginning with his starter inspired by Britpop pioneers Oasis. Later, Samira opts a lobster and crab spicy dish called 'Tikka Look At me Now' for her fish course, while Mike uses turbot for the second Oasis-inspired dish of the day, titled 'Champagne Supernova'

programme.title: Cheetah Family & Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Wildlife film-maker Gordon Buchanan gets close to wild cheetah in the Kalahari, experiencing first-hand the very real dangers these beautiful big cats face. With the help of guides Richard Satekge and Julius Mkhize, this programme follows two female cheetah, each with a litter of cubs, as they navigate harsh environments, dangerous wildlife and dwindling prey

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: Steph McGovern leads the makers through the ages from the 17th century to the present day, revealing how Stoke-on-Trent dominated the pottery industry, transforming from a collection of rural villages to a city that became the world capital of ceramics. The makers are first tasked with making elementary butter pots, before moving on to an oblong-shaped tea canister, decorated with blue cobalt pigment. They also study the invention of Bone China, use a 'jiggering' machine to shape clay into a plate and visit celebrated pottery company Wedgwood

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents the show from Crowcombe Court, west Somerset, where experts James Lewis and Thomas Plant discover some promotional Victorian sausage plates

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powell's 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenham's jazz festival

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day two of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. Australia have not lost a Test at this venue since 1981, winning four and drawing three contests here since then

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the first day of the tournament, which takes place at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, Merseyside. This is the 13th time overall that the prestigious competition has been held on this course, and the first time since 2014, when Rory McIlroy claimed the third of his four Major titles. With commentary by Andrew Cotter, Ned Michaels and Ken Brown

programme.title: The Real McCoy
programme.desc: Comedy sketches, written and performed by leading black and Asian artists, including Curtis Walker, Ishmael Thomas, Llewella Gideon and Meera Syal. Originally broadcast in 1991

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Four new couples begin sessions with Dr Orna Guralnik, with Brock and Kristi unpacking their Mormon upbringing as they search for a new foundation, while Josh struggles with Natasha's lack of intimacy

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Christine's childhood PTSD surfaces, Josh's sexual frustration boils over, Erica reveals her resentment of Sean, and Brock struggles to lay bare Kristi's betrayal

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The woman who raised thousands of pounds for her best friend's cancer treatment, only to find out the diagnosis was a lie. Plus, Dr Xand and co-host Ashley John-Baptiste reveal whether 10,000 steps really is a magic number when it comes to staying healthy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Costume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. ostume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards have just 24 hours on a limited budget to organise her space, create a bespoke craft area, and clear the chaos from the conservatory

programme.title: Lullaby (2019)
programme.desc: A lawyer hires a nanny to look after her two children when she returns to work. She quickly becomes an essential part of the family's daily existence, but her actions start to take a disturbing turn, setting in motion a tragic cycle of mutual dependence. Crime drama, starring Karin Viard and Leïla Bekhti. In French

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Nigeria v Canada (Kick-off 3.30am). Coverage of the Group B match, which takes place at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Warwickshire, where he gets a glimpse of the work being done for the new HS2 railway infrastructure. In Stratford-upon-Avon he learns about the founding of the Royal Shakespeare Company, before a visit to Birmingham, where he recalls the redevelopment of the city centre during the 1960s and the arrival of black and Asian communities

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. With The Hampton Court Garden Festival just around the corner in July, Carol is at home immersing herself in some of the plants she's growing for her highly ambitious show garden. And wildlife champion Kate Bradbury discovers a fascinating array of moths in her garden

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v Costa Rica (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the Group C match, which takes place at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Miranda Krestovnikoff joins volunteers in an exercise dealing with aquatic mammals which are washed up on the UK's shores, and Nick Crane reports on car transportation

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the £10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of Vanessa Bell, Rachmaninov, Sherlock and David Bowie, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The North East chefs serve up their music-themed main courses and desserts. Mike Carr combines Yorkshire hogget and Lancashire hotpot in his northern dish Rack 'n' Roll, Samira Effa brings the Nigerian flavours of her childhood to the kitchen with her dedication to the Mobo Awards, and Tom Anglesea is inspired by the Sting song Fields of Gold for his main, which uses guinea fowl as its centrepiece

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge record producer Pete Waterman

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges a sculptor, a ceramicist and a painter to create something to celebrate a couple's 25th wedding anniversary, on a budget of £800

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: Steph McGovern leads the makers to Wensleydale in the Yorkshire Dales, where they examine the area's famous cheese, as championed by Wallace and Gromit. Focusing on the Monastic period, Jason and Claire try to milk a sheep, while Katie and Charlton extract rennet - an enzyme vital in cheesemaking - from a sheep's stomach. Moving on to the Victorian era, Charlton and Jason tackle the highly physical task of collecting 20 litres of milk each in heavy back cans. The makers are then propelled to the 1920s when early factories employed equipment such as thermometers to produce cheese on a much larger scale

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team heads to Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where Christina Trevanion and David Fletcher assess items including a large collection of boxed Corgi toys and some rare watches. Paul Martin discovers the dramatic political life of one of Sandon's earlier owners, who was a member of William Pitt's cabinet in tumultuous times

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills before Richard Osman announces the week's winner

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From Tewkesbury in Gloucestershire, Michael Portillo heads to the castle of Eastnor at the foot of the Malvern Hills. He also visits Coleford in the Forest of Dean, Slimbridge in Gloucestershire, and Bristol Temple Meads. From there he heads to Filton to investigate the centre of Britain's post-war aviation industry

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team reports from the biggest horticultural event in the north - the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries and growers in the country. Also, Nick Bailey shines a botanical spotlight on begonias, and Toby Buckland visits a Liverpool community who have regenerated their streets through collective gardening

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the second day of the tournament, which takes place at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, Merseyside. Cameron Smith is the reigning champion following his victory at St Andrews last year, in what was the 150th staging of the Major

programme.title: The Catherine Tate Show
programme.desc: Award-winning sketch show, featuring the comedienne as an assortment of quirky and oddball characters, with a guest appearance by Siobhan Redmond

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day three of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. Australia won by 185 runs when the sides last met here in this format in 2019, but England have won all four of their Tests at this venue since

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: The team transforms an old washstand, a broken-up sofa, and a collection of vintage clothing, picked up by Sarah Moore at Wallyford Recycling Centre

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Northumberland. Mark Sr regales his sons with facts about Hadrian's Wall, local castles and the origins of Earl Grey tea. The history buff is in charge of choosing the night's accommodation and picks rooms in 800-year-old Chillingham castle - which Mark Jr is horrified to discover is reputed to be the most haunted castle in Britain. The next morning the trio partake in a little coasteering, which involves climbing up and down the rocky shoreline and jumping off cliffs into the North Sea. The visit ends with a relaxing trip to a spa

programme.title: Brave Britain with Fergal Keane
programme.desc: Award-winning reporter Fergal Keane goes in search of hope in today's Britain, turning to those in hard-pressed communities and hearing stories of everyday courage. From Glasgow shipyard workers to Leeds council estate residents to tenant farmers in Cornwall, Fergal shines light on the unheard voices of courage across the country

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels help Chipmunk deliver his packages

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Peggee and the Hummingbirds journey up the river to deliver a parcel, they have fun spotting and avoiding the wildlife that they meet along the way

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Grape Kids learn how to camp Supertato-style, but Evil Pea arrives and wows them with her ice camping

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer tries to keep the Farmer's new trainers spotlessly clean

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Miss Mistry offers thumb wrestling as a solution to resolve Dennis and Walter's spiralling competitiveness

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Lake District finding out how cycling is still one of the top outdoor pursuits in the UK, and how electric bikes are opening up the countryside like never before. Adam Henson talks to farmers taking part in a sheep shearing competition, and Tom Heap explores the impact of banning snares

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Zambia v Japan (Kick-off 8.00am). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group C, which takes place at Waikato Stadium in Hamilton, New Zealand

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The natural history documentary follows the work of tough Australian Chris 'Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to rescuing and raising orphaned kangaroos in the outback near Alice Springs. This two-part film follows Brolga as he expands operations by opening his doors to a whole new bunch of animals, including a trio of camels, a southern hairy-nosed wombat and three emu chicks, as well as building a wildlife hospital

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve leads a team of experts - including world-leading underwater cave explorer Robbie Schmittner, former Royal Marine Aldo Kane and diving camera operator Katy Fraser - into the Yucatan Peninsula in Mexico. Under the vast jungle is the largest unexplored network of caves in the world, comprising thousands of kilometres of passageways. They are beautiful but dangerous, as much of the system is under water. First, the team must trek through tough, scorpion-infested jungles to camp alongside a giant sinkhole - a dark gateway to an underworld full of nightmarish creatures

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge challenges fellow chef Glynn Purnell to create a recipe from scratch to go up against his own new creation, with each having a set of rules to work from, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries to persuade them to be open-minded as he asks them to sample wine from a surprising source. Plus, comedy actress Arabella Weir meets a man who puts many chefs to shame when it comes to experimenting with flavour

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Denmark v China (Kick-off 1.00pm). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group D, which takes place at Perth Rectangular Stadium in Australia. The Danes are playing in their first World Cup since they were eliminated at the group stage in 2007, while China reached the last 16 four years ago in France

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher offer up some designs to help Reena and Wes create more space in their three-bedroom 1960s terrace house in Borehamwood, which they've outgrown since moving in 12 years ago. With Wes often working from home, daughter Nyla's toys are competing for space with the desk and the kitchen doesn't have space for a table, so they eat all their meal on their knees in the living room. With family in Barbados and in the UK, Reena and Wes are desperate to create some space to get everyone together

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how the camera transformed the relationship between the monarchy and the British people during the 64-year reign of Queen Victoria, whose accession to the throne in 1837 coincided with the invention of photography. The monarch, whose private life became more visible than ever before, managed to turn the pursuit from a pastime into a political weapon in her battle to safeguard the British throne

programme.title: The Young Victoria (2009)
programme.desc: The turbulent early years of the monarch who, shortly after being crowned, became caught in a power struggle between her mother and scheming politicians Lord Melbourne and Sir Robert Peel. Meanwhile, a romance develops with her German cousin and eventual husband, Prince Albert. Historical drama, with Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Paul Bettany and Miranda Richardson

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, where Philip Serrell discovers a postcard signed by Malcolm Campbell showing him in his boat Bluebird. Jonathan Pratt gets excited about a collection of fans, while Paul gets aboard the Cutty Sark, the last surviving tea clipper

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day four of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. England will be looking to continue their exemplary record in Test matches at this venue since the turn of the century, which has seen them win 13 of the 19 contests and lose just once, although that loss was at the hands of Australia in 2019

programme.title: Golf: The Open
programme.desc: Action from the third day of the tournament, which takes place at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, Merseyside. Viktor Hovland and Rory McIlroy each recorded a six-under-par 66 at the corresponding stage of last year's tournament at St Andrews to rise to the top of the leaderboard in a share of first place, on an overall score of 16 under

programme.title: The Who at the Electric Proms
programme.desc: A 2006 performance by the veteran rock group at the Roundhouse in the London borough of Camden, featuring tracks including My Generation, Baba O'Riley and Pinball Wizard as well as material from the band's mini-opera Wire and Glass

programme.title: Quadrophenia (1979)
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. But bit by bit, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone

programme.title: The Who at Glastonbury
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe looks back at the rock band's headline set on the Pyramid Stage in 2007, when the veterans closed proceedings at that year's fetival

programme.title: Up There (2012)
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Sweden v South Africa (Kick-off 6.00am). Coverage of the match from the opening round of fixtures in Group G, which takes place at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand

programme.title: Yorkshire Walks
programme.desc: Artist Shanaz Gulzar walks through the Bolton Abbey Estate, heading out from Bolton Priory along the River Wharfe and over moorland to her journey's end at Simon's Seat and its views across Wharfedale, Nidderdale and beyond. Meeting fellow walkers along the way, Shanaz finds inspirational spots to sketch and recite poetry, while discovering hidden woodlands and waterfalls

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how skeletons have evolved to help animals sense the world around them, revealing why predators like wolves have their eye sockets at the front of their skulls, whereas many prey creatures have a wider fields of vision. The presenter also looks at the hearing abilities of the grey owl, and another animal's flexible nose

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis charts the stories behind the shipwrecks of the Georgian age, when Britain's naval fleet was considered the most powerful in the world. He learns how mutinous sailors, rebellious slaves and murderous wreckers threatened to undermine the country's dominance at sea at a time when it was establishing key colonies and acquiring new territories

programme.title: Sweet Charity (1969)
programme.desc: A lonely but optimistic dancer in a seedy nightclub goes in search of true love, but finds instead a succession of deceitful men who only let her down. When she meets a shy, claustrophobic man in a lift, she thinks he might be the one - but tries to keep her past a secret. Musical, with Shirley MacLaine, John McMartin, Ricardo Montalban and Sammy Davis Jr, and featuring songs including The Rhythm of Life and Big Spender

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at television appearances made over the years by outspoken actress Shirley MacLaine, capturing the milestones and highlights of her life and career that led to her being considered a Hollywood icon. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: An Evening with Sammy Davis Jr
programme.desc: A compilation of the singer, actor and dancer's performances for the BBC, filmed in the 1960s, featuring classic songs including My Funny Valentine and Once in a Lifetime. The entertainer demonstrates his impersonations of well-known stars of the era, with cameras capturing him also being quick on the draw with a pistol

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day three of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Emirates Old Trafford. Australia won by 185 runs when the sides last met here in this format in 2019, but England have won all four of their Tests at this venue since

programme.title: Beethoven's Fifth at the Proms
programme.desc: The BBC National Orchestra of Wales and conductor laureate Tadaaki Otaka perform Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, recorded on 19th July at the Royal Albert Hall. Star violinist Elena Urioste joins the orchestra to perform Samuel Coleridge-Taylor's Violin Concerto, and Rachmaninov's Five Études-tableaux receives its first ever Proms outing in orchestration by Respighi. Presented by Katya Adler

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.desc: David Jensen presents an edition first broadcast on July 19, 1979. Featuring performances by the Real Thing, Dave Edmunds, Darts, UK Subs, the Pretenders, the Knack, Sparks, the Boomtown Rats, the Dooleys, Abba, the Korgis and Tubeway Army. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Madness: Live in Hyde Park

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the Great Plains - 500,000-square miles of flat, treeless grassland - became the setting for some of the Wild West's most dramatic events. Ray joins members of the Blackfeet Nation as they demonstrate bare-back riding skills before undertaking a ritual buffalo hunt and sacrifice. At a cattle auction in Dodge City, Kansas, he reveals stories about the railways and cow-towns before learning about the life of an iconic figure - the cowboy

programme.desc: The Stockholm police are called out to investigate the killing of a man who was brutally murdered in his own home. Crime drama, starring Peter Haber. In Swedish

They travel around town to record their new song, attend a music workshop with their friends, perform their new song for the first time in front of a big audience, and even see amazing wildlife in Nairobi National Park. When Daisy hears, she tells Ruby about protesting, and the two of them decide to go and protest on the beach in the hope that people will stop dropping litter. All the Hubbers pitch in, making ‘Save Swishy’ badges, hats, signs and Swishy biscuits. Daisy is delighted when Mack writes a special protest song to get the message out about reducing plastic pollution.

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a couple who are looking to lay down roots in Devon after decades serving in the Army. They have a £400,000 budget to find their ideal home near the English Riviera. Away from the property hunt, Ginny capitalises on being in Devon at the same time as the County Show to find out what it takes to win Pig of the Year

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Rob and Helen call upon the skills of Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull to inject some character into their bland new-build garden in Eastergate, West Sussex. They want the garden to be modern and stylish to reflect their interiors and also have space for entertaining, so task the designers to realise their dreams on a budget of £5,700

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneers Charles Hanson and Natasha Raskin Sharp explore the fens and wolds of Lincolnshire in the bygone glamour of a 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles spends a fortune and bakes a cake, while Natasha gambles on a rare plate and comes across a Nigerian prince in the most unlikely of places

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, brother Josh and father Big Mark's road trip comes to an end in Cornwall, where they swim with horses in the shadow of St Michael's Mount. On a visit to a farmer's market, Josh and Mark take a bite of the world's hottest chilli pepper before heading to Hayle beach to try kitesurfing. Their training involves Mark Sr being repeatedly dunked in the sea - much to the amusement of his sons. The final accommodation is a villa on a private island accessible only by its own private suspension bridge. The trio then visit the Eden Project and take in the spectacular views from an enormous swing

programme.title: Iolo's Anglesey
programme.desc: Iolo Williams goes by boat to Ynys Badrig, an offshore island which is the northernmost point of Anglesey and Wales, and the potential site of new gannet colony. He also explores a stunning wood at the centre of Anglesey with carpets of spring flowers and native red squirrels. The presenter watches peregrines on the Menai Straits, and on wetlands near RAF Valley, find nesting sand martins, spots otters and enjoys a rare sighting of a bittern

programme.title: Firebombers
programme.desc: Part one of two. In 1979, four holiday homes in Wales were torched in one night. This marked the beginning of an arson campaign targeting second homes owned by English people, whom the attackers claimed were destroying Welsh culture because of their part-time presence. Over the next decade, more than 200 homes and businesses were attacked by a secret organisation known as Meibion Glyndwr

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Young couple Emily and Maurice's narrow new-build garden in Bristol leaves a lot to be desired. They dream of an elegant Mediterranean-inspired space to rekindle happy holiday memories. Working within a £2,500 budget Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull create a stylish, contemporary spot that brings sunshine vibes to the pair's lives

Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

Charles takes part in a whirlwind shopping dash and also finds time to travel to Waddesdon in Buckinghamshire and the home of Baron Ferdinand De Rothschild. Natasha spends over £300, including a Victorian ink and wash painting of a grumpy girl and a stunning 19th-century Italian bronze vase

programme.desc: The endeavours of golden retriever koda, an assistance dog to Mei, who having spent much of her teen years in care suffers from anxiety issues and an eating disorder. Before Koda arrived, 20-year-old Mei was too scared to leave her home, but now they are venturing out together. Koda is prone to falling asleep on the job and has a lot to learn, so Mei has signed them up for further training to help build the confidence she needs to head from Norfolk to London to participate in a function alongside Children's Commissioner for England, Rachel de Souza

However, Lee's decision to play Poirot when a stranger turns up unannounced in their carriage risks Lucy's special day being ruined. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie takes on a more positive attitude, but then, one by one, things start to fall apart. Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family forced to move to Australia to become their Queen. Catherine Tate stars, with Rodger Corser

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: A whistlestop journey through Welsh number one hits, featuring many of Wales' best loved artists across seven decades. The programme begins in 1959 with Shirley Bassey's first time at the top of the Hit Parade and then comes up to date with DJ Fresh's Dubstep smash, featuring the vocals of Caerphilly's Sian Evans. Along the way there's also music from Tom Jones, Duffy, Bonnie Tyler, Manic Street Preachers, Stereophonics and a classic from the biggest selling UK singles artist of the '80s

Saints defeated Hull FC 32-18 away from home in their quarter-final match, while Leigh progressed to this stage of the competition following a 34-14 victory at York City Knights

programme.title: Clive Sullivan: Rugby League Legend
programme.desc: Football icon Nathan Blake uncovers the incredible story of a Welsh rugby legend - his uncle, Clive Sullivan - who was the first black man to captain Great Britain in any sport. Nathan's journey begins in Cardiff, Clive's hometown, where he discovers that Clive was part of an exodus of gifted black rugby players, who left the city for the north of England. He speaks to fellow former player Terry Michael, who tells us that he felt no option but to move north to continue his playing career, and to an array of former Hull FC and Hull Kingston Rovers players, in a city in which he is still regarded with the highest respect

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans delves into the BBC Wales archive of 1979, a year of protests, Come Dancing and Bonnie Tyler. Wynne's loyal companion Ginny sleeps through most of it, so misses the farmer who gives up his cows

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: An anxious Karen faces hearing the results of her chemotherapy. Meanwhile, Maggie tries to persuade a broken Lydia to seek professional help, and Stevie struggles living with two teenagers

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Keanu seeks legal advice over access to Peggy and tries to get an order in place to stop Lisa taking her out the country, meanwhile Lisa tries to get what she needs to make a flight to Portugal. Stacey tells Martin the truth about her cam work

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, brother Josh and father Big Mark's road trip comes to an end in Cornwall, where they swim with horses in the shadow of St Michael's Mount. On a visit to a farmer's market, Josh and Mark take a bite of the world's hottest chilli pepper before heading to Hayle beach to try kitesurfing. Their training involves Mark Sr being repeatedly dunked in the sea - much to the amusement of his sons. The final accommodation is a villa on a private island accessible only by its own private suspension bridge. The trio then visit the Eden Project and take in the spectacular views from an enormous swing

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Young couple Emily and Maurice's narrow new-build garden in Bristol leaves a lot to be desired. They dream of an elegant Mediterranean-inspired space to rekindle happy holiday memories. Working within a £2,500 budget Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull create a stylish, contemporary spot that brings sunshine vibes to the pair's lives

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Gravity (2013)
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by his uncle Matheson Green and nephew Daymon Britton, heading to Rothbury in Northumberland to sample a guided bird-watching walk before setting up camp on a farm that rents out converted horseboxes.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple hoping to relocate to rural Somerset on a budget of £700,000, looking for a home with enough land for animals and a glamping site. Away from the hunt, Alistair gets stuck in with some Cheddar making in the county where it originated

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Kettering to design a garden for Bridget that stirs childhood memories of her home in Ireland and remind her of holidays taken there

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Natasha Raskin Sharp head south to Hertfordshire in the super glam 1932 Riley Monaco. Charles takes part in a whirlwind shopping dash and also finds time to travel to Waddesdon in Buckinghamshire and the home of Baron Ferdinand De Rothschild. Natasha spends over £300, including a Victorian ink and wash painting of a grumpy girl and a stunning 19th-century Italian bronze vase

programme.title: Pointless

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Reporting Scotland; Weather
programme.desc: The latest news and weather from BBC News Scotland. Presented by Sally Magnusson

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The endeavours of golden retriever koda, an assistance dog to Mei, who having spent much of her teen years in care suffers from anxiety issues and an eating disorder. Before Koda arrived, 20-year-old Mei was too scared to leave her home, but now they are venturing out together. Koda is prone to falling asleep on the job and has a lot to learn, so Mei has signed them up for further training to help build the confidence she needs to head from Norfolk to London to participate in a function alongside Children's Commissioner for England, Rachel de Souza

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: It is Lucy's birthday and to celebrate Geoffrey and Wendy take her Lee, Toby and Anna for a trip on a vintage steam train. However, Lee's decision to play Poirot when a stranger turns up unannounced in their carriage risks Lucy's special day being ruined. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Georgie takes on a more positive attitude, but then, one by one, things start to fall apart. Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family forced to move to Australia to become their Queen. Catherine Tate stars, with Rodger Corser

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017)
programme.desc: Peter Parker balances life as an ordinary high school student with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, while waiting in vain to join his mentor Iron Man on a world-saving mission. Determined to prove he is ready for bigger challenges, he investigates a spree of crimes committed with advanced weapons - leading him into a battle with a ruthless winged enemy on the hunt for priceless technology. Superhero adventure, starring Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Vietnam (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the opening match in Group E, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. The Americans have won the last two stagings of the tournament and it would be a major upset should they fail to defeat the tournament debutantes

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Patrick Williams and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed plus special guests Hilary and Michael Whitehall. Helen McGinn picks the wine to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: This time, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite recipes for low cost baking, using ingredients that do not break the bank or compromise on flavour. Dishes include fluffy onion pretzels, a potato rosti quiche, rhubarb and custard kisses, and her signature rich and indulgent chocolate fondant

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Phillip Serrell are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. Charlie Ross presents

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: St Helens v Leigh Leopards (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which takes place at Halliwell Jones Stadium in Warrington. Saints defeated Hull FC 32-18 away from home in their quarter-final match, while Leigh progressed to this stage of the competition following a 34-14 victory at York City Knights

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items. First to arrive is Princess from Surrey, with an unusual item - a set of wooden, carved apples, which are cut into different numbers of sections and were used to help children learn about fractions. Next, part-time entertainer Chris brings in a bed of nails, before 18-year-old Jude presents the dealers with a beautifully preserved, original account of a First World War Zeppelin raid on Southend

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull transform Lauren and Jonathan's Birmingham plot into a magical haven, taking their lead from a famous children's book that means a lot to the couple

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a father and daughter from from Bradford, two friends from Surrey, and a married couple from Swansea

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan asks general knowledge questions against the clock as contestants try to win money for their chosen charity and avoid being voted off the team. This episode features are Martin Roberts, Tanni Grey-Thompson, Melvin Odoom, Anneka Rice, John Bercow, Kelle Bryan, Richard Blackwood and Suzi Ruffell

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present the star-studded general knowledge quiz. Matt Richardson, Adam Rowe, Rav Wilding, Wayne Perrey, Sarah Cawood, Matthew Wright, Maisie Adam and Emily Lloyd-Saini try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna struggles through a relentless run of back-to-back shifts at the ED dealing with challenging cases - but exhaustion starts to take its toll, ending in disaster. Iain offers to help Faith with her recovery, but his proposed solution only drives her away. Sah confesses to Teddy, and Jan regrets her recent actions when she realises the damage it has caused to her relationship with Ffion

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Bosco is reunited with an old friend from prison, but the pressure of touring takes a toll on his mental health. His downward spiral culminates in a disastrous gig when he goes on stage drunk and initiates a serious confrontation with Bulla. The incident is too much for Honey, who starts making alternative plans. Meanwhile, Vita makes a decision she may later come to regret, and discovers a surprising side to her mother when Beres shows her a video of young Aria

Determined to prove he is ready for bigger challenges, he investigates a spree of crimes committed with advanced weapons - leading him into a battle with a ruthless winged enemy on the hunt for priceless technology. Superhero adventure, starring Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Vietnam (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the opening match in Group E, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. The Americans have won the last two stagings of the tournament and it would be a major upset should they fail to defeat the tournament debutantes

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Patrick Williams and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed plus special guests Hilary and Michael Whitehall. Helen McGinn picks the wine to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: This time, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite recipes for low cost baking, using ingredients that do not break the bank or compromise on flavour. Dishes include fluffy onion pretzels, a potato rosti quiche, rhubarb and custard kisses, and her signature rich and indulgent chocolate fondant

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Revisiting a semi-detached property in the West Midlands. Plus, Tommy Walsh meets a first-time developer in Sittingbourne, Kent, and Martel Maxwell views a property in Tyne & Wear

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Phillip Serrell are on hand as two teams test their antiques knowledge at the Three Counties Showground in Malvern, Worcestershire. Charlie Ross presents

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: St Helens v Leigh Leopards (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which takes place at Halliwell Jones Stadium in Warrington. Saints defeated Hull FC 32-18 away from home in their quarter-final match, while Leigh progressed to this stage of the competition following a 34-14 victory at York City Knights

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items. First to arrive is Princess from Surrey, with an unusual item - a set of wooden, carved apples, which are cut into different numbers of sections and were used to help children learn about fractions. Next, part-time entertainer Chris brings in a bed of nails, before 18-year-old Jude presents the dealers with a beautifully preserved, original account of a First World War Zeppelin raid on Southend

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull transform Lauren and Jonathan's Birmingham plot into a magical haven, taking their lead from a famous children's book that means a lot to the couple

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a father and daughter from from Bradford, two friends from Surrey, and a married couple from Swansea

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan asks general knowledge questions against the clock as contestants try to win money for their chosen charity and avoid being voted off the team. This episode features are Martin Roberts, Tanni Grey-Thompson, Melvin Odoom, Anneka Rice, John Bercow, Kelle Bryan, Richard Blackwood and Suzi Ruffell

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present the star-studded general knowledge quiz. Matt Richardson, Adam Rowe, Rav Wilding, Wayne Perrey, Sarah Cawood, Matthew Wright, Maisie Adam and Emily Lloyd-Saini try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Donna struggles through a relentless run of back-to-back shifts at the ED dealing with challenging cases - but exhaustion starts to take its toll, ending in disaster. Iain offers to help Faith with her recovery, but his proposed solution only drives her away. Sah confesses to Teddy, and Jan regrets her recent actions when she realises the damage it has caused to her relationship with Ffion

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Bosco is reunited with an old friend from prison, but the pressure of touring takes a toll on his mental health. His downward spiral culminates in a disastrous gig when he goes on stage drunk and initiates a serious confrontation with Bulla. The incident is too much for Honey, who starts making alternative plans. Meanwhile, Vita makes a decision she may later come to regret, and discovers a surprising side to her mother when Beres shows her a video of young Aria

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians (2018)
programme.desc: When New York University professor Rachel Chu heads to Singapore with her boyfriend, Nick Young, she's surprised to learn he's from an extremely wealthy family. The problem is they aren't so approving of her, so she attempts to win them over. Blockbusting comedy based on Kevin Kwan's novel, starring Constance Wu, Henry Golding, Gemma Chan and Michelle Yeoh

programme.title: The Bling Ring (2013)
programme.desc: Five teenagers united by an obsession with celebrity steal from the houses of the rich and famous stars they idolise, using the internet to follow their targets' movements. When the police finally catch up with them, the arrest brings a taste of the fame they have craved. Fact-based drama, starring Emma Watson and Israel Broussard

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: Examining the business stories and economic trends that are re-shaping our world.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: Carmen Roberts visits Chile to see some of the ways the country is changing as it faces a once-in-a-generation vote on the rewriting of its constitution. In the Atacama Desert, she visits a water ceremony held by the local indigenous people who stand to gain recognition in the new constitution. In Arica, Carmen hears how the ancient Chinchorro mummies are being more widely understood after recognition by Unesco. Finally, she visits the south of the country in Patagonia, where a vast conservation and rewilding effort is set to impact the area for years to come.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Shiona McCallum heads behind the scenes at Wimbledon to find out how artificial intelligence is playing its part in this year's competition. James Clayton explores how tech is being used to detect deepfake images. Plus, Spencer Kelly catches up with Internet pioneer Vint Cerf.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Women and Gambling: My Secret Addiction
programme.desc: Over the last five years, the number of women seeking help for gambling addiction has more than doubled in the UK, according to the charity GambleAware. As many women grapple with the stigma of addiction, the BBC has been given exclusive access to the first women's residential treatment centre for gambling, based in central England. In this film, Rachel Stonehouse explores the issues around women and gambling addiction, both in the UK and around the world, and asks why it is a secret for so many.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. She recalls an opera about fabrics that she wrote and performed at high school for a home economics project, how she staged puppet shows for children's parties, and the huge impact that reading George Orwell had on her

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the second of two Tonight programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Kate Quilton looks at the impact our diet can have on our later years

programme.desc: Builder and father-of-two Kieran set fire to his mother-in-law in an ultimate act of hatred against his wife Susan. But what caused this horrendous spiral of violence, and what could have been done to avoid it? Using text messages, 999 call recordings, archive footage, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Susan herself, this film looks at the downward spiral of coercive control, domestic violence and drug abuse that led to a horrifying and tragic murder

programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the second of two Tonight programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Kate Quilton looks at the impact our diet can have on our later years

programme.desc: Builder and father-of-two Kieran set fire to his mother-in-law in an ultimate act of hatred against his wife Susan. But what caused this horrendous spiral of violence, and what could have been done to avoid it? Using text messages, 999 call recordings, archive footage, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Susan herself, this film looks at the downward spiral of coercive control, domestic violence and drug abuse that led to a horrifying and tragic murder

programme.desc: Ventress goes in search of a bogus water board official who has been robbing the elderly, but ends up investigating a suspicious death linked to one of the burglaries. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Merrick is called out to a remote farmhouse, where she discovers three children have been left orphaned by the death of their father. programme.desc: Steve does his bit for the community by taking a group of delinquents on an outdoor adventure course on the moors, but one of the lads falls and breaks his ankle, while another is wanted for stealing from a shop. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading 'They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. Steel is then put under intense scrutiny when it is revealed that his success in convicting Dillon was largely due to selective prosecution. Bradley Walsh and Ben Daniels star
