programme.desc: As the Morgan brothers sit in wait for Angela, they make Katy suffer by denying the terrified girl her insulin. Luckily, Kevin realises something is wrong and calls in the police

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A philandering husband is found dying by the swimming pool after being shot during a house party at the home of Lady Lucy Angkatell. Legendary Belgian Sleuth Poirot, who is guest of honour at the gathering, appears to have an open-and-shut case on his hands - but the investigator finds himself up against one of his finest adversaries. Whodunit, guest-starring Sarah Miles (Ryan's Daughter), with David Suchet, Lysette Anthony and Edward Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa helps out her ex-boyfriend Danny when he brings seven children from London to camp on Ruth's farm - supervised by Al and Bert - while she and Martin plan a date on the advice of Dr Timoney. However, their night at the restaurant is interrupted when Danny calls saying one of the youngsters has gone missing. Things get worse for the couple when Martin uncovers a health scare at James's first birthday party that makes all the guests leave very quickly. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is not best pleased when her new art teacher Erica wants to try out some rather alternative ideas on the children, while Dr Timoney is involved in a car accident outside the school. Penhale is confused when he is offered a transfer to Exeter, Bert decides to go back to being a handyman, and Louisa and Martin are intrigued when Dr Timoney invites them for an additional therapy session. Plus, an American tourist seeks help from the GP. Comedy drama, with a cameo appearance by Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate a hospital department where three patients have died in suspicious circumstances in six months - the latest being a woman brought into A&E with flu-like symptoms. The detectives learn she died after being given a lethal cocktail of prescription drugs - but with an unsigned patient chart and an extremely busy evening on the ward, tracking down the killer proves challenging. Crime drama, guest starring James Fox, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: An old case puts a stop to Dean's work plans and awakens insecurities for Manning, causing him to have second thoughts about his future in the force. Later, Jenn and Karen discover evidence that suggests a key witness in the investigation lied about his alibi, and they rush to track him down before it's too late. Starring Marsha Thomason and Christopher Coghill

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: While furious Jenn is determined to prove who attacked her family, she is forced to focus on the cases in hand. Manning considers his future, and Erin makes a life-changing decision that upsets Chris. When a surprising connection to another piece of evidence is brought to light, the missing pieces of the investigation finally fall into place

programme.desc: A family problem provides the feuding fathers with common ground, prompting them to set aside their differences - for the time being. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.desc: Part two of two. Nick's attempted suicide implicates him in Emma's death and Annabel casts light on the mystery. Drama, with James d'Arcy and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.desc: King Henry VIII plots to rid himself of his new French wife when her craving for garlic becomes too much to cope with. However, he cannot afford to anger the king of France, and tries to make it look as if his queen has had an affair. Comedy, starring Sid James, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor and Kenneth Connor

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Coma victim Harriet Farmer finally wakes up a year after she was attacked while trying to elope, but her boyfriend Finn Robson is still missing. Soon after she regains consciousness, members of a chess club are targeted by a killer. Could the assault that left Harriet for dead be linked to moves on a games board? Guest starring Fay Ripley (Cold Feet), with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When dairy worker Debbie Moffett (played by Martine McCutcheon) is crushed to death by a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue, Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case. Pathologist Kate Wilding discovers the victim's daughter was being expelled from the local prep school and it emerges Debbie died just hours after an argument at a parents' council meeting. Her phone leads the detectives to Oliver Ordish, with whom she was having an affair

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in this drama based on the novels of Georges Simenon. The summer of 1955 finds Paris in the grip of both sweltering heat and terror on the streets. Four women have been murdered in Montmartre, with no apparent connection between the victims. Chief Inspector Maigret comes under huge pressure from the public and his superiors to apprehend the killer before he can strike again. Fiona Shaw and Mark Heap head up the supporting cast

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Heartbeat

Meanwhile, Blaketon seeks to rectify a miscarriage of justice by reviving a pre-war darts tournament between the Aidensfield Arms and the White Lion, and Gina begins to get cold feet about her impending marriage to Phil. Rural drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth goes on an Egyptian cruise on board an old steamer, but when an American heiress is murdered, his little grey cells go into overdrive. On questioning each of his fellow passengers, he realises many of them have secrets they want to remain hidden. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading 'They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. Steel is then put under intense scrutiny when it is revealed that his success in convicting Dillon was largely due to selective prosecution. Bradley Walsh and Ben Daniels star

programme.desc: Dean is faced with another life-changing event, and unable to deal with his grief, he returns to work. With tensions running high, Jenn fears that he may resort to doing something he regrets. Elsewhere, Conor takes matters with Maddie into his own hands

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A philandering husband is found dying by the swimming pool after being shot during a house party at the home of Lady Lucy Angkatell. Legendary Belgian Sleuth Poirot, who is guest of honour at the gathering, appears to have an open-and-shut case on his hands - but the investigator finds himself up against one of his finest adversaries. Whodunit, guest-starring Sarah Miles (Ryan's Daughter), with David Suchet, Lysette Anthony and Edward Fox

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly man reports an unusual break-in, during which the uninvited visitor left a mysterious statue on the kitchen table. It soon emerges that it is just the first in a series of unexplained events, as a police phone box arrives and then disappears from his garden, cement is delivered to his house for no apparent reason and a fire is started in his garage. Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa helps out her ex-boyfriend Danny when he brings seven children from London to camp on Ruth's farm - supervised by Al and Bert - while she and Martin plan a date on the advice of Dr Timoney. However, their night at the restaurant is interrupted when Danny calls saying one of the youngsters has gone missing. Things get worse for the couple when Martin uncovers a health scare at James's first birthday party that makes all the guests leave very quickly. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa is not best pleased when her new art teacher Erica wants to try out some rather alternative ideas on the children, while Dr Timoney is involved in a car accident outside the school. Penhale is confused when he is offered a transfer to Exeter, Bert decides to go back to being a handyman, and Louisa and Martin are intrigued when Dr Timoney invites them for an additional therapy session. Plus, an American tourist seeks help from the GP. Comedy drama, with a cameo appearance by Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate a hospital department where three patients have died in suspicious circumstances in six months - the latest being a woman brought into A&E with flu-like symptoms. The detectives learn she died after being given a lethal cocktail of prescription drugs - but with an unsigned patient chart and an extremely busy evening on the ward, tracking down the killer proves challenging. Crime drama, guest starring James Fox, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: An old case puts a stop to Dean's work plans and awakens insecurities for Manning, causing him to have second thoughts about his future in the force. Later, Jenn and Karen discover evidence that suggests a key witness in the investigation lied about his alibi, and they rush to track him down before it's too late. Starring Marsha Thomason and Christopher Coghill

programme.title: The Bay

programme.desc: Part two of two. Nick's attempted suicide implicates him in Emma's death and Annabel casts light on the mystery. Drama, with James d'Arcy and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.desc: King Henry VIII plots to rid himself of his new French wife when her craving for garlic becomes too much to cope with. However, he cannot afford to anger the king of France, and tries to make it look as if his queen has had an affair. Comedy, starring Sid James, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor and Kenneth Connor

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are enlisted to design a memorial garden based on the myth of Orpheus and Eurydice, but someone begins vandalising their work on a nightly basis. Matters are complicated still further by the death of a recovering alcoholic, whose body is found at the site. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris, with Phyllida Law, Joanna David and Daisy Dunlop

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary's old school friend Dorothy invites the duo to restore the gardens of her beautiful villa on the French Riviera so the property can be opened to the public. The plan arouses bitter hostility among the neighbours and long-held family secrets start to surface, leading to murder. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Millionaire's wife Mary Pritchard, a notoriously demanding invalid, apparently dies of shock in her locked room when the geranium in her wallpaper turns blue, fulfilling the dire warning of a mysterious fortune teller. The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective is ordered to take a holiday for the benefit of his health, and with Hastings and Miss Lemon in tow, reluctantly heads for the tranquillity of Devon's coast, where his relaxation is soon ruined by the discovery of a socialite's murdered body on the beach. Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Coma victim Harriet Farmer finally wakes up a year after she was attacked while trying to elope, but her boyfriend Finn Robson is still missing. Soon after she regains consciousness, members of a chess club are targeted by a killer. Could the assault that left Harriet for dead be linked to moves on a games board? Guest starring Fay Ripley (Cold Feet), with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When dairy worker Debbie Moffett (played by Martine McCutcheon) is crushed to death by a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue, Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case. Pathologist Kate Wilding discovers the victim's daughter was being expelled from the local prep school and it emerges Debbie died just hours after an argument at a parents' council meeting. Her phone leads the detectives to Oliver Ordish, with whom she was having an affair

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in this drama based on the novels of Georges Simenon. The summer of 1955 finds Paris in the grip of both sweltering heat and terror on the streets. Four women have been murdered in Montmartre, with no apparent connection between the victims. Chief Inspector Maigret comes under huge pressure from the public and his superiors to apprehend the killer before he can strike again. Fiona Shaw and Mark Heap head up the supporting cast

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Three weeks after reporting her husband missing, adult-film star Vicky Birkinshaw is arrested on suspicion of his murder. Rachel faces the task of going through the suspect's home-made pornography collection in search of clues, but the case takes a dark twist when Vicky's daughter turns up with her much older boyfriend. Meanwhile, Janet's affair with a colleague is exposed. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

After 30 years of marriage and a few difficult years back at home, the couple have decided it's finally the right time to fulfil their long-held dream of buying a place in the sun. Lee sources five properties within their £50,000 budget

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: It's an exciting day for Amy and Marc, as they get an award for their renovations and host a picnic in their garden for 60 of the organisation's members. However, the garden is criss-crossed by open trenches for all their ongoing plumbing and electrical work. Becky and Mark are under pressure to complete their final guest room, but they still find time to introduce their daughters to two new kittens. In north west France, Philip and Angelina are flat out preparing for the events season. The moat must be navigated to smarten up the chateau's enormous shutters and Angelina makes over a kilometre of bunting. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez try to make holiday home dreams come true for retired NHS worker Julie from Swansea, whose perfect pad includes two bedrooms, outside space and room for her best friend to visit. It's up to the Rodriguez sisters to come up with the goods on a 105,000 euro budget. In Málaga, Shani and Andrew Hamilton search for a Spanish home for husband and wife Mike and Eva. Eva grew up by the sea in Cornwall and is keen to add a swim in the sea to her morning routine, so a place close to the beach is a priority. She hopes her budget of 230,000 euros will secure this ambition

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Spoof behind-the-scenes special exploring what makes the dysfunctional family's antics so popular. Featuring the guest voices of Willie Nelson, Gary Coleman and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul is attacked as he leaves a club night at The Loft, Cindy wakes up in hospital and has to face reality, and Yazz and Tom feel a strain on their relationship

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A new student enrols in the imposing form of a four-year-old newfador called Ruby. Eight-stone of solid dog, Ruby refuses to budge when owners Nichola and Zeal take her for a walk. However, trainers Sean and Kamal soon there's more to Ruby's stubbornness than meets the eye. Six-year-old Maltese Bichon cross Marco arrives with fed up owner Beth in tow. Beth inherited Marco from her late father - and Marco's repaying the favour by ignoring every word Beth says

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The work of a pioneering veterinary practice, where 'Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick and a team of more than 100 surgeons, nurses, ward attendants and physiotherapists help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets through cutting-edge treatment and operations. This series opens with a special episode featuring the amazing stories - old and new - of some of the youngest and cutest puppies for whom Noel has provided life-saving treatment since The Supervet began in 2014, and the families at the centre of their inspiring stories

programme.title: Rosie Jones: Am I a R*tard?
programme.desc: The comedian takes the opportunity to explore and educate viewers on the online abuse faced by those with disabilities, including herself as a person with cerebral palsy. She sets herself the challenge of confronting a troll directly, and explores the role that social media plays in the rise of this abuse. Rosie wants everyone in the UK to be made aware of ableism and to stand up to it when they see it and for everyone to play their part in ending the suffering of people who are abused simply because of their disability

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Two divorcees go in search of a more successful match, and a woman who despairs of ever finding the right man finds her head turned from her date to another man in the restaurant. A barbershop owner tries to settle his nerves by drinking heavily before the date, and an unconventional neuroscientist looks for love with an artistic woman who has always put other people's needs first, but now wants something for herself

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Nottingham's Queen's Medical Centre, 87-year-old Joan is brought in after falling on a moving tram and cutting open the back of her head. Elsewhere, 19-year-old Rose faces life-changing injuries after being thrown into the air by a car, and 13-year-old Prince has broken his leg in three places playing football

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Drama following the untold story of Elizabeth I, before she ascended the throne. Henry VIII's death throws a young orphan Elizabeth Tudor into the unpredictable and dangerous English court. As her nine-year-old brother is crowned king and the great families of England and powers of Europe vie for control of the country, she and her siblings become pawns in a dangerous game

programme.title: Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland and Beyond
programme.desc: Actors Miriam Margolyes and Alan Cumming take off on a motorhome adventure to rediscover their Scottish roots. They start out in Glasgow, visiting the street where Miriam's Jewish family first lived in Scotland, then journey north into the Highlands. Alan learns about his ancestral past at Cawdor Castle, they meet up with fellow actor Bill Paterson and stop off in Carnoustie, where things take a somber turn as Alan remembers his abusive childhood

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that 'Netflix and chill' doesn't mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwright's shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Plymouth compete for the £1,000 cash prize. On the first night, beauty therapist Christine and fiance Kevin surprise their guests, while the second day sees young married couple Harvey and Natasha opt for a Spanish theme. Estate agent Paul and his wife Jo try to pull off an ambitious menu for the final meal of the week, but Paul must keep his nerves at bay as the pressure mounts

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two pairs of house-hunters. Chris and Nicola from Hastings were newlyweds searching for their dream home nine years ago, while couple Trudi and Steve relocated from Edinburgh to North Yorkshire in order to be closer to family

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bowlero is a global bowling company with thousands of employees and hundreds of centres. It became a bowling giant almost overnight when it took over AMF and Bowlmor Lanes. Colie Edison created every element of the Bowlero brand. Now she wants to go undercover to find out how the new Bowlero is working for staff and customers. As her alter ego Michelle, who recently lost her job as a court reporter and now wants to find a second career, Colie works as a trainee manager, a lane server, an event host and a trainee facilities manager

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this behind-the-scenes look at the biggest players in Britain's crisp industry. The snack aisle is a brutal place, where every cheesy puff, crisp and tortilla chip fights for its place on the shelf. This programme meets the crisp industry's biggest players, whose job it was to make sure their brand stays ahead of the competition, no matter what. It's a fierce battleground where three brands - Smiths, Golden Wonder and Walkers - have fought for decades to out-flavour, out-sell and outwit their rivals to achieve complete crisp domination

programme.desc: Lee McGregor v Erik Robles Ayala. Live coverage of the bout for the vacant IBO World Super-Bantamweight title, which takes place at Meadowbank Sports Centre, Edinburgh. McGregor comes into this contest on the back of a 13-fight unbeaten run that includes 12 victories and nine knockouts, while Mexico's Ayala boasts a similar record of 13 wins and one loss, and is fighting outside of his home country for the first time

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Norway, camera follow a train journey that begins in the capital Oslo and heads all the way to Bodo inside the Arctic Circle. The first leg is the Dovre line, running from to the remote northern wonderland of Trondheim. Along the way it passes through the vast Gudbrandsdal valley and across the awe-inspiring Dovrefjell mountain plateau. The route stops at the picturesque mountain village of Dombas, before changing to the Rauma railway, which features dramatic fjords opening out along the Rauma river, dotted with some of the country's most famous landmarks. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: The Funny Thing About
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Anthea Turner, Vanessa Feltz, Carl Fogarty, Nish Kumar and Nina Wadia are joined by a selection of British comedy stars to share their thoughts on the many weird habits, off-putting quirks and wild eccentricities people are willing to put up with while 'in relationships'. Through honest confessionals and witty anecdotes, the assembled talking heads ask how people even know they are officially an item, and celebrate some of the more endearing romantic gestures that come along with the inconveniences of sharing a life with someone else

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents the life and work of the Western world's most gifted artists, beginning with Giotto di Bondone, the son of a Tuscan shepherd. Born in 1267, Giotto began his apprenticeship at the age of 12, and with his naturalistic treatment of medieval Christian iconography, was recognised as the first in a line of great painters and architects who contributed to the Italian Renaissance

While they're away, single mum Millie will be in charge at home keeping an eye on her teenage brothers and the four dogs - as well as looking after baby Ophelia

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: It is all change at the Radford house as one child moves back home and another moves out, with Luke returning from the RAF, and Chloe deciding to move in with her boyfriend Jake. Meanwhile, 12-year-old Max decides to build a device to help Sue with the daily mountain of laundry, and the children prepare to see their grandmother Christine, who they haven't seen in over a year

programme.title: Inside Legoland: A World of Wonder
programme.desc: It is mid-summer and the staff are working at full stretch to keep guests happy and the rides working. programme.desc: Helen Lederer narrates a selection of nightmare stories of people, including a trip to Northern Ireland in which millions of midges turn one camper's life into a living hell. Also featured are a person who ended up in a face-off with a lion while on safari in South Africa, while a holiday to Snowdonia took a sinister turn when two female backpackers returned to their car to find their tyres had been slashed

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: The Island's High Sheriff Kay Marriot attends the annual Steam Fair, where she tries her hand at some Morris dancing with all-female troupe the Oyster Girls. In Bembridge, John Attrill is the fifth generation of his family to work in his village's RNLI and he's hoping that his seven-year old-son Teddy will follow in his footsteps

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: A look at the history of Holyrood House in Edinburgh, which is the official royal residence in Scotland and saw bloody struggles for power when it was home to Mary, Queen of Scots. Kate Williams tells the story of a royal tomb raider and his ill-gotten booty from the grave of Charles I

programme.title: Meghan: Famous But Friendless?
programme.desc: A look at what the future holds for the Duchess of Sussex, after burning her bridges with the royal family and recently losing a $20million deal with streaming giant Spotify. The programme examines the fallout from interviews dishing the dirt on the royal family, and explores who she can rely on and who will help her in the next stage of her personal and professional life

programme.title: All New Most Shocking Celebrity Moments
programme.desc: A countdown of the 40 most talked-about celebrity stories of 2019, featuring interviews with the key participants and celebrity fans. The programme looks back at events including the breakdown of Miley Cyrus and Liam Hemsworth's marriage, and the dramatic fall out between Colleen Rooney and Rebecca Vardy

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bill Nighy narrates a journey that starts at Tirano and climbs up through the Italian Alps and lakes through into Switzerland, taking in the Landwasser Viaduct. At Disentis, the train track changes to a cog railway as the gradient gets steeper, and a much bigger engine is added to climb the steep mountain route. The journey then reaches its conclusion at Zermatt, sitting at the base of the majestic Matterhorn

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Mosque
programme.desc: Meera Syal narrates a documentary going behind the scenes at the Baitul Futuh mosque in Morden, south London, home to Britain's 30,000-strong Ahmadi Muslim community. The film reveals the defining moments of life at the mosque, from finding love to committing to faith as well as looking at international celebrations and a tragedy that devastates the entire community

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow profiles scientist, engineer, inventor and painter Leonardo da Vinci, whose extraordinary artistic genius gave rise to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, the Annunciation and the Last Supper. Breaking new ground in portraiture and historical imagery, this giant of the Italian Renaissance used his wide-ranging skills to make a unique contribution to the development of European art

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice visits Headcorn to help a couple spruce up their tiny cottage in a bid to make it more attractive to prospective buyers, clearing out all their clutter, getting rid of a dingy carpet and using small furniture to create an illusion of space

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet learns how windmills turn wheat into flour, while the Milkshakers learn how to make windmills

programme.title: Paw Patrol

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)
programme.desc: A British colonel in a Japanese PoW camp is ordered to build a railway bridge over a river, forging a vital communications link. At first he refuses to obey, but eventually agrees to take the project on - and becomes so obsessed with the task that he creates a dilemma for an American soldier sent to destroy the structure. David Lean's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: Instant Family (2018)
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders' comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: Arrival (2016)
programme.desc: The world is thrown into uproar when 12 alien spaceships arrive at locations around the globe. As tensions rise between nations and fear of the arrivals grows, a recently bereaved linguist is recruited by the US army to find a way to communicate with the aliens and discover why they have come. Sci-fi drama, starring Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Collateral (2004)
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Mann's thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Caught in Time (2020)
programme.desc: A detective tracks down a gang of criminals a decade after they initially evaded arrest. Lau Ho Leung's action crime thriller, starring Daniel Wu and Qianyuan Wang. In Mandarin with English subtitles

programme.title: Anne of the Indies (1951)
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes (1955)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley

programme.title: The Colditz Story (1954)
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea (1954)
programme.desc: The captain of a nuclear submarine battles a gigantic octopus threatening to destroy San Francisco. Monster adventure, starring Kenneth Tobey, Faith Domergue and Donald Curtis, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Deep Impact (1998)
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: Armageddon (1998)
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi

programme.title: Dredd (2012)
programme.desc: An uncompromising law enforcer in a post-apocalyptic city is assigned to train a psychic new recruit. A report of three murders leads them to a tower block dominated by a ruthless drug lord, only for the gangster to seal off the building, forcing them to fight their way out. Sci-fi thriller based on the 2000AD comic-strip, starring Karl Urban, Lena Headey and Olivia Thirlby

programme.title: Airplane II: The Sequel (1982)
programme.desc: Hapless hero Ted Striker tries to prevent the launch of a passenger space shuttle, certain it will end in disaster. Sadly, his prediction comes true when a computer malfunction sends the spacecraft hurtling toward the sun, while a man driven mad by sexual inadequacy smuggles a bomb on board. Disaster movie spoof sequel, starring Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Lloyd Bridges, William Shatner, Sonny Bono and Chad Everett

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan (1984)
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Monster Trucks (2016)
programme.desc: A drilling operation unleashes a subterranean creature which feeds on oil. The monster bonds with a monster truck which a local teenager is building from spare parts, and the youngster befriends the beast and helps it to return to its underground home. Fantasy adventure, starring Lucas Till and Jane Levy

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Gemini Man (2019)
programme.desc: An aging assassin is targeted by a mysterious young operative that seems able to anticipate his every move. Discovering that he's being hunted by a younger clone of himself, Henry needs to find out why he's being targeted and who the creator is. Action drama, starring Will Smith, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Clive Owen

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin (2021)
programme.desc: Margot, a young woman who was abandoned by her mother as a baby, travels to a secluded Amish community with a documentary film crew seeking answers about her mother and extended family. Horror thriller, starring Emily Bader, Roland Buck III and Dan Lippert

programme.title: The Vigil (2019)
programme.desc: In Jewish law, a shomer is a person who agrees to watch over the body of a recently deceased member of the community. Yakov, who has stepped away from his Hasidic roots following the death of his younger brother, is asked to act as an overnight shomer for Holocaust survivor Mr Litvak. The deceased's wife is in the grip of dementia and is unfit to stand vigil over Mr Litvak. Yakov accepts this important role and prepares for a long night of quiet contemplation. Thriller, starring Dave Davis and Menashe Lustig

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: If he wants to fight to keep the market, Tom has a tough decision to make. Meanwhile, Cindy struggles with her mental health, and James helps Grace

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in New Jersey to help Rose Leone, who spent two years in a coma and came out of hospital to learn her son Michael had run her once-thriving Italian restaurant into the ground. With a menu of more than 126 dishes, the quality of the food is suffering, and even the chefs refuse to eat their own creations

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: First of a two-part special in which Gordon Ramsay heads to the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions are running high because owner Alan Saffron has spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. To make matters worse, the kitchen is run by a chef called David Blaine who shares nothing of his famous namesake's magic when it comes to cooking - and whose threatening behaviour regularly gets him into trouble

Howard and Bernadette begin to worry when Raj starts treating his new phone like a person, while Sheldon and Amy try to achieve internet fame by creating a video podcast about flags

programme.title: Modern Family

Guest starring Rachael Harris (The Hangover)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is driven to distraction when a tune becomes stuck in his head, while Amy and Dave arrange another date and Howard and Raj discover their band has a fan, but tracking him down turns out to be a mistake. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together, while Leonard, Howard and Raj must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket. Plus, Sheldon's Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave's patience is tested when Gemma's sister suddenly shows up with plans for an extended stay

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Phil swap parenting roles, Gloria falls for a sob story, and Jay helps an overzealous entrepreneur with his dog training scheme. Meanwhile, Mitch finds himself torn between looking after Cam, who is in bed with flu, and attending a Lady Gaga concert. Comedy, directed by The Wonder Years star Fred Savage, featuring Julie Bowen, Ty Burrell and Sofia Vergara

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The family gathers at Jay's ahead of Alex's graduation and stays longer than intended. Jay tries to conceal a Botox slip-up, Cameron is angered by Mitch's tendency to laugh at his expense and Claire feels emotional about the rate her children are growing up

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw takes part in a scientific experiment, and Sheldon introduces a new club named Silence Club. Iain Armitage stars

programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, husband and wife Aidan and Mij Nattrass welcome their rivals to the Earlston House Hotel in Paignton, Devon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Beach House in Portland, Dorset, where Pete Lacey feels his back-to-basics approach offers his guests good value. But things get heated with the radiator in Karen and Liam's room and opinions are laid bare over dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Karen and Liam are shocked by their payment from Pete, while Carolynne and George want to find out what caused Karen and Liam to lose sleep at their place

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Golden poison frog Pablo has lost interest in his partner Maria, so 'bad boy' El Loco is brought in to shake things up. In the chimpanzee habitat, there is a power struggle for the role of dominant female, and baby porcupine Marion fends off the meerkat mob

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton visits Woodgreen animal charity, keen to find a dog she can co-parent with her mother. She meets Leilo, but the Rhodesian ridgeback's long-term medical needs require serious consideration. Lovebirds Shai and Orin's try to hit it off with Polo the lurcher, while Zoe the beagle meets the Forristal family

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of a dual-purpose family and wheelchair-friendly home built by design engineer and former Paralympic swimmer Mark Butler. Mark was paralysed from the waist down following a motorcycle accident and the home he currently lives in with his family makes it virtually impossible for him to complete even the simplest of tasks around the house. He and his wife Penny want to build a cutting-edge family home, with a drive-in basement, passenger lift and accessible kitchen and bathroom. However, building such a unique property proves a huge challenge, and the strain on Mark and Penny becomes almost unbearable

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the expert archaeologists revisit some of their most exciting archaeological adventures - from incredible Roman revelations to the unveiling of Viking faces from the past. Armed with trusty trowels and spades of enthusiasm, Hugh and the team have been digging in back gardens across the country for the past few years, all in a quest to uncover new chapters of history. With help from local communities, they reveal the secrets beneath the nation's feet

programme.title: Ancient Secrets of Althorp with Charles Spencer
programme.desc: Documentary following the 9th Earl of Spencer, who has always been fascinated by rumours of a lost Anglo Saxon village believed to have been located in the grounds of his ancestral home. He organises an archaeological dig to search for evidence, and while few traces of the sought-after settlement emerge, something far older comes to light - a Neolithic encampment which experts believe is more than 5000 years old

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia. A woman with a history of emphysema comes to St George's after complaining to her GP of chest pains, and a 19-year-old medical student has an abnormal growth on her femur

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Co Durham, heli-medics battle to keep Mick alive after he has a seizure. A fun day takes a turn at the motocross track that leaves 12-year-old Ollie with a limb-threatening injury. And in the Yorkshire Dales, there's a dramatic hillside rescue for seriously-injured paraglider Alastair

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to save a grandmother with severe osteoporosis who fell down the stairs carrying her four-month-old grandson. In Stratford, paramedics Mandy Morrice and Michelle Godwin treat a racegoer on a night out who collapsed in the street and suffered a serious head wound. In Warwick, a concerned member of the public calls emergency services to a suspected cardiac arrest but ends up becoming the patient himself. Plus, Neil Vann and Laura Perkins give life-saving treatment to an elderly man found unconscious face down in his hallway

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia. A woman with a history of emphysema comes to St George's after complaining to her GP of chest pains, and a 19-year-old medical student has an abnormal growth on her femur

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Another selection of the team's favourite investigations, including Kate Quilton's visit to McVitie's in Carlisle to find out why so many biscuits have little holes all over them. Jimmy Doherty heads to Portugal to see how corks are made for wine bottles, while Matt Tebbutt is in Italy to learn why mascarpone is more expensive than other soft cheeses

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Noiw approaching retirement, Wirral couple Catherine and Paul have their hearts set on a holiday home to enjoy with their families on the Costa Adeje in Tenerife. Laura Hamilton lines up five fantastic properties within their budget of £150,000 for them to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Spain, the emergency services are called when a bike crashes on a remote mountain. In Normandy, a history buff leads his first battlefield tour, while a couple pack up their B&B in France and head to Málaga

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien restores an enamel roll-top bath and builds a den out of old doors. Henry Cole makes a wall mounted safe from a jerry can and lovingly restores a cheese-making trough

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire and Worcestershire. Henry makes a table from the base of a broken agricultural grain mill, while Simon creates a garden seat from an old mangle

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The race is on to find heirs to the £100,000 estate of a woman from Southsea, and the search uncovers the romantic story of a husband and wife who met while serving in the Navy. Plus, an heir seeks to learn more about her aunts and uncles and makes a poignant discovery about her mother's twin brother. The programme also provides details of other unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the heirs of a man whose family worked for London Underground during the Blitz. Plus, the programme explores how investigations into an unclaimed estate revealed the story of an aviation engineer who helped design the Lysander plane before the Second World War

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Bowling Green in Chorlton-cum-Hardy, Manchester, where owner Mark Canny hopes his newly refurbished rooms and head for hosting will secure him success. Guests James and Fiona rave about their room, but Martin and Petra find a few furnishing faults. At dinner, Mark gets his guests giggling, while Andrew and Qidi's revelation that they're big hitters in the five-star hotel world sends everyone's expectations sky high. In the morning, Mark's Irish breakfast gratifies the guests, but a fridge feud leaves him far from chilled

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Redhill Holidays in Whitbourne near Worcester, a glamping site with pole-perched premier pods - and an unwelcome population of insects

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week comes from the Mode Lytham Hotel in Lytham, Lancashire, where husband-and-wife team Andrew and Qidi Whitaker hope their hotel will bag them best in show

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Villa Farm Cottage in Thornton Curtis in Lincolnshire, where perfectionist Petra Coates and her partner Martin Littlefield run a tight ship. When the guests arrive, the bathroom tiles take Andrew back to his public swimming pool days and Mark has a moan about a missing en suite. In the morning, the guests are spoilt for choice as Petra provides a German cold meat feast followed by an English breakfast cooked by Martin. However, Andrew and Qidi's feedback about the tiling leaves Martin and Petra planning to hit back on payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Mark from the Bowling Green Hotel questions Martin and Petra about a lack of chairs and then gives Qidi and Andrew's noisy fridge comments a frosty reception

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Eastern black rhino Zuri gives birth to baby Ike, and sun bears Toni and Millie are having relationship issues. Meanwhile, Bactrian camel Shan-shan is under the weather, so the Chester keepers are trying to work out how to help her

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Married couple Dexter and Aaron are looking for a fluffy, chunky dog. Ellie the chihuahua will have to prove that being neither fluffy or chunky isn't a problem when it comes to being their perfect match. Yoga teacher Venessa and son Jacob try to assess whether there is a bond between them and Zoe, a friendly beagle who has been trying to sniff out a new home for a while. Plus, Stanley the anxious Staffie meets 'dog-mad' pair Linda and Richard

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets former army captain Justin, who has spent £1.8million on an abandoned neo-Gothic cemetery keeper's lodge and adjoining ex-council toilet block in south-west London. Justin's vision is to restore the lodge but demolish the ugly toilet blocks and replace them with an enormous luxury ground-floor extension, with an added moat and a giant basement with a swimming pool - all just metres from the nearest grave

programme.title: Disturbing Disappearances
programme.desc: Small-time dealer Tony is shocked when one of his regulars dies of an overdose after he sells her drugs. Tony needs to cover up his supply trail to make sure his wife and family aren't affected by his criminal behaviour. Pregnant Maya Rosetti convinces her partner Clement to help her solve this conundrum. Crime drama, starring Sara Forestier, Pierre Rochefort and Bruno Dreyfurst. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Gus is rushed to the department after going over the handlebars of his bike. Patricia, 73, is in extreme pain, having dislocated her shoulder months ago. Bryan arrives with a swollen and painful hand after falling while walking his daughter's dog

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 70-year-old man is rushed to St George's after he is found struggling to breathe. His daughter shares the story of how her father overcame his long battle with alcoholism. The wife of a man receiving treatment for foot and knee pain shares how her childhood taught her the importance of being there for your partner in marriage. A woman and her five-year-old son are rushed to St George's after being hit by a car

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Rob Beckett to go up against Jon Richardson and Cariad Lloyd in the comedy words-and-numbers quiz. Jamie Laing joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old Gus is rushed to the department after going over the handlebars of his bike. Patricia, 73, is in extreme pain, having dislocated her shoulder months ago. Bryan arrives with a swollen and painful hand after falling while walking his daughter's dog

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Europe's biggest brewery - Heineken in the Netherlands - on a mission to explain the difference between lager and ale. His journey takes a surprising twist when he comes face to face with the mother of all lagers. Kate Quilton sets Matt Tebbutt the challenge of making crumpets, and finds out how they get filled with unique holes at the Warburtons factory in Enfield, north London. Matt also heads for snowy Canada to discover why maple syrup is so expensive, and finds out that maple syrup robberies are a big concern to the industry

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Maggie and Alistair from Edinburgh dream of buying a holiday home on the southern coast of Gran Canari, famous for its famous white sandy beaches. Jasmine Harman shows Maggie and Alistair five potential properties, but will any of them prove to be their dream holiday home?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Amando and Vanessa from the West Midlands find a holiday home in Tenerife, tracking down five properties within their budget of £185,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ravin and Pritti from Surrey want to sell up in the UK and find a new permanent home for themselves and their extended family in Gran Canaria. They've visited neighbouring Canary Islands such as Tenerife and Lanzarote before but never Gran Canaria, and after extensive research have decided that it's where they want to be. They have £180,000 for the big move. Jean Johansson lines up five properties for the duo to consider

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the first of the challenges in chocolate week, Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles task the four remaining teams with making 24 chocolate-domed figurines and 24 desserts. For the showpiece challenge, the teams must create 48 chocolate bars, presented within a dramatic chocolate showpiece inspired by archaeology and featuring a moving part. Judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden are looking for a tall, beautiful and technically precise creation that is good enough to win a team a spot in the next stage of the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Grange Farm Park in Maltby le Marsh, Lincolnshire, which is run by mum and daughter team Ann Graves and Rebecca O'Brien. Guests Emily and Warren marvel at their luxury room, while father and son Bis and Deep can't wait to dive into their hot tub. But Marilyn and Neil are concerned that their bathroom might be a bit cramped. After a day out feeding baby seals at a local seal sanctuary, the B&Bers congregate at the on-site restaurant for dinner, where Marilyn isn't pleased to find out that she and Neil are the only guests without a hot tub

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Marilyn and Neil Tuson host the second night of the week at Edgecliff Boutique B&B in Birchington-on-Sea, Kent - hoping the breathtaking views will give them the edge they need. Guests Emily and Warren are big fans of their room's sea views, but Bis and Deep find a dirty kettle and Ann and Rebecca aren't happy about a dusty chandelier. Later, in the morning, there's a long wait at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Vera's Kitchen and B&B in Lechlade, Gloucestershire, where young owners Warren Neinaber and Emily Mapson hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in to the Preston Hotel in Yeovil, owned by father and son Bis and Deep Oozageer. Ann and Rebecca find their room more cheap than cheerful, although an afternoon tasting the produce at a cider brandy distillery proves a massive hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners reunite, ready to air their grievances from throughout the week. Ann and Rebecca from Grange Farm Park aren't happy with Marilyn marking them down for the lack of a hot tub, and Marilyn herself isn't too pleased when her and Neil review the feedback for their slow breakfast service at Edgecliff Boutique B&B

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the £1,000 prize. But she's worried about being in the firing line, after Rosie compared Muneer's food to vomit on the first night. Now Moony's determined to give Rosie a public dressing down. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. And after laid-back Muneer and critical Rosie seem to have put their tension behind them at Christine's, Ben's determined to take things up a notch as he entertains his guests with his amazing body art, cooking skills and pet crabs

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fridge salesman Gregory serves up a Spanish menu in Peterborough, accompanied by a charm offensive that he hopes will win him the £1,000 prize. Will it work or will the guests give him the cold shoulder?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fiery Brazilian Rosie is confident that her night will be the best of the week in Peterborough. After Gregory used packet mixes, Rosie is determined to show him how to throw a dinner party by making everything from scratch. She's ruffled a few feathers throughout the week with her brutally honest critiques, and her guests, roused for retribution, scour every element of her Brazilian night for any faults, from her samba dancers to her authentic pig-ear stew

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Compilation of highlights from the documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, including a couple having to choose between a French bulldog and a nervous terrier, a jack russell finding a family that need a dog able to keep up with them, and a dog offering to pull his prospective owner's wheelchair along

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A mother and son must choose between a stray westie and a young Staffie cross. Plus, a nine-year-old client comes in with a long list of exactly what he wants in a dog

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: The host travels to Saudi Arabia and Jordan, and visits the iconic sites and undiscovered jewels that are only just becoming accessible to tourists. From the natural beauty of the Red Sea, with its outstanding corals and marine life, to the ancient rock art and desert camps of local Bedouin tribes, testament to humanity's connection to this awe-inspiring landscape over millennia

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Katie is rushed to St George's by helicopter after a riding accident. The 46-year-old's horse has fallen on top of her, resulting in multiple broken bones and internal injuries. Amy has a deep laceration to her ankle after a party with her flatmates ended with her falling onto a gin glass, and Pamela has suffered a sudden bout of back pain, leaving her in agony

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff at St George's Hospital in south-west London treat patients from three different generations. Leo is in A&E after crashing his car and flipping it on its roof. Leo's husband JR tells the story of how the two men met and how some members of their family struggled to accept their marriage. Meanwhile, young Kieran has hurt his wrist tumbling off his skateboard and 91-year-old Lillian has fallen over at home

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and Katherine Ryan join Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for the words-and-numbers game, while David O'Doherty joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Another selection of favourite investigations, with Jimmy Doherty heading to South Africa on the trail of sweet piquante peppers and visits the company that has exclusive rights to grow, process and market these colourful chillies. Kate Quilton is in Hawaii to investigate the potentially dangerous levels of mercury in tuna, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why the bags of ice cubes in supermarkets are so crystal clear

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers intercept an arsenal of weapons being smuggled into Mexico, a deadly consignment of Fentanyl is discovered in a freezer and agroup of Guatemalan immigrants is stranded at the bridges

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Bernie puts together the first-ever Streamliners festival - though unprecedented levels of flooding in New South Wales threatens to end his dream. Jeff races time to haul a huge ore train across the Outback.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo sets off on another tour of his home country, this time exploring the north of Italy. In the first edition he examines the food that has shaped the city of Florence, beginning by tackling the bistecca alla Fiorentina - a thick and juicy steak - before preparing sliced T-bone with a colourful courgette ribbon and goat's cheese salad. He then heads to the town of Prato, sampling a pastry chef's speciality brioche buns with an aromatic, creamy filling, and conjuring up his own dessert of apple poached in red wine with amaretti biscuit cream

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's next stop is Venice, where he takes a trip on a gondola with a countess to find out about a type of Venetian tapas called cicchetti, before creating his own ciabatta-based platter, featuring courgette and fennel with capers, prawns on chilli mayonnaise and breaded cod on lemon mayonnaise. The chef then heads out of the city to the nearby island of Burano, where he participates in a highly unusual method of cooking risotto

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Scunthorpe, Ione's head for heights is tested, while Barry and Darren try strongarm tactics to put the other bidders off. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The bidders are in Chalfont St Giles, Buckinghamshire where Heavy D and Sam team up, and Charlotte and Shaun have a father/daughter fall out. Sean Kelly hosts

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: The Drug Squad hunts for an illegal fuel stash hidden deep in the Rock of Gibraltar, and Customs officers find valuable intelligence in an abandoned boat

programme.desc: Chris Harris, Paddy McGuiness and Freddie Flintoff aren't choosing their own cars, but instead choosing for one another. programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo explores the gastronomic region of Emilia-Romagna. In a part of Italy famous for its cured meats, the chef is amazed to find an ancient cellar packed with prized culatello, including one reserved especially for Prince Charles. He then buys a wedge of Parmesan cheese and uses it to enhance a colourful dish of fried aubergine, tomato and mozzarella, topped with basil and olive oil dressing. His culinary quest continues in Modena, where he samples some of the world's finest traditional balsamic vinegar and prepares chicken and pancetta served with asparagus and cherry tomato salad

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo tours the picturesque region of Liguria in north-west Italy. His first stop is the village of Camogli, where he meets a family making a living from fishing tourism, before preparing sea bass in caper and butter sauce served with griddled, marinated carrots. Keen to explore more of the coast, the chef heads to Recco, where he helps a baker prepare the town's famous type of focaccia. Finally, Gino rustles up one of Liguria's most popular dishes - trofie pasta with rustic pesto, green beans and potato

Their first challenge is finding suitable headgear to protect from the scorching Italian sun. They then take a guided tour in vintage Fiat 500 cars, and after wending their way past the Circus Maximus finish atop Gianicolo Hill in time for the cannon being fired - a daily ritual since the 1850s. Next they head to the border of the Vatican, before experiencing the very best of modern Italian cuisine. Day two sees visits to the Trevi Fountain and the Colosseum, perhaps Rome's most incredible antiquity

Darren and Natalie Brown are in Murcia with sports fanatics Jane and Alan who want to move from Dubai to Spain to be a bit closer to their family and future grandchildren in the north of England without giving up the sunshine.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition takes place in and around Leeds, where the first host, 38-year-old choir teacher Dionne, serves up a menu that combines European and Caribbean influences and celebrates her family favourites, with a carnival flourish thrown in for good measure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Finance director Jane hosts the second night in Leeds. Her plan to grab the grand is to treat her guests to a night of fine dining, but she has her work cut out. Drama teacher Denver is already on the back foot with Jane, after taking offence to being called a 'goth' on the first night. Car painter Darren is concerned that Jane's menu of home-made ravioli, pork and panna cotta could win the week, but he's less impressed when it gets to the table. Painter and decorator Billy has noticed a chilling change among some of the other diners and Dionne is just glad her night is out the way so she can enjoy the rest of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Drama teacher and DJ Denver hosts the third dinner party in Leeds, with a Spanish-inspired menu that also includes a prosecco van and stilt walkers on arrival

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the contest in Leeds finds Darren planning to put a fancy twist on what seems to be a basic menu. Denver still hasn't forgiven Jane to likening her to a goth on the first evening and the fact that Darren is serving goat's cheese rubs salt in her wounds. Billy is concerned about the amount of mustard Darren is using in his dishes and mother-of-five Dionne causes a commotion when she offers up a hug to Jane

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

For the showpiece challenge, the teams must create 48 chocolate bars, presented within a dramatic chocolate showpiece inspired by archaeology and featuring a moving part. Judges Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden are looking for a tall, beautiful and technically precise creation that is good enough to win a team a spot in the next stage of the competition

programme.title: A Royal Guide To
programme.desc: The work of staff members maintaining the royal family's many properties, including St James' Palace, Holyrood House, Buckingham Palace, Clarence House and Kensington Palace. Featuring the daily routine of the royal upholsterer, the rescue of hundreds of precious artefacts from a burning Windsor Castle, why a salmon got a police escort through London, and Prince Charles' love of the chicken pen at Highgrove

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George heads to Kent to help Pete and Amelie make their huge 16 room Victorian house fit for modern life, with plans to make a playroom and a library. Amelie makes a trip to Shropshire to make her own encaustic tiles in one of the last remaining factories in the country to use traditional methods. Plus, George revisits Michele in Warwickshire to see how she is getting on remodelling her adjoining Grade II listed cottages

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring catalogue of errors that occurred in the run-up to the nuclear disaster, examining newly declassified evidence from the KGB archives about the safety of the plant. programme.title: The Dog House

Lovebirds Shai and Orin's try to hit it off with Polo the lurcher, while Zoe the beagle meets the Forristal family

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
